text: There is nothing impossible to him who will try.
author: Alexander The Great

text: I am not afraid of an army of lions led by a sheep; I am afraid of an army of sheep led by a lion.
author: Alexander The Great

text: I am indebted to my father for living, but to my teacher for living well.
author: Alexander The Great

text: Upon the conduct of each depends the fate of all.
author: Alexander The Great

text: A tomb now suffices him for whom the whole world was not sufficient.
author: Alexander The Great

text: I would rather live a short life of glory than a long one of obscurity.
author: Alexander The Great

text: It is a lovely thing to live with courage and die leaving an everlasting renown.
author: Alexander The Great

text: Every light is not the sun.
author: Alexander The Great

text: Remember upon the conduct of each depends the fate of all.
author: Alexander The Great

text: I am not afraid of an army of lions led by a sheep, I am afraud of an army of sheep led by a lion.
author: Alexander The Great

text: I am not afraid of an army of lions lead by a sheep; I am afraid of sheep lead by a lion.
author: Alexander The Great
